title: What Genre Should You Write In?
description: Discover your perfect writing genre based on your creative instincts and storytelling style

traits.contemporary_romance: Writes love stories that heal hearts and restore faith in happily ever after
traits.dark_romance: Explores the shadows of desire in love stories that dance on the edge of danger
traits.psychological_thriller: Crafts mind-bending stories that explore the dark labyrinth of the human psyche
traits.fantasy: Builds magical worlds where anything is possible and epic stories unfold
traits.literary_fiction: Illuminates the human condition through beautiful language and profound insight
traits.young_adult: Captures the intensity and possibility of young adulthood in inspiring stories
traits.historical_fiction: Brings the past to life through meticulously researched and emotionally resonant stories
traits.suspense: Masters the art of keeping readers on the edge of their seats with breathless anticipation
traits.self_help: Shares wisdom and practical strategies that genuinely improve people's lives
traits.memoir: Transforms life experiences into universal stories that inspire and connect
traits.historical_romance: Weaves passionate love stories against the rich tapestry of bygone eras
traits.science_fiction: Explores the infinite possibilities of the future and technology's impact on humanity

questions.question: When you envision your main character, what draws you to them most?

answers.text: Their vulnerability and the emotional wounds they carry from past relationships
The dark secrets they're hiding and the dangerous game they're playing
Their magical abilities or the fantastical world they must navigate
The life-changing wisdom they discover and want to share with others
Their complex psychology and the moral ambiguity of their choices

questions.question: What kind of world-building excites you most?

answers.text: Creating intricate magic systems with detailed rules and consequences
Recreating historical periods with rich authentic details
Building realistic contemporary settings where emotions feel raw and real
Constructing tense, claustrophobic environments that mirror psychological states
I prefer focusing on characters and relationships over detailed settings

questions.question: How do you prefer your romantic relationships to unfold in stories?

answers.text: Slow burn with emotional intimacy building gradually through shared experiences
Intense, passionate connections with elements of danger or forbidden attraction
Romance as a subplot that enhances character development but doesn't dominate
Sweet, idealistic love stories that inspire hope and healing
I'm more interested in exploring other types of relationships and connections

questions.question: What drives your plot forward most effectively?

answers.text: Internal character growth and emotional transformation
External threats, mysteries, or time-sensitive dangers
Epic quests, battles, or magical conflicts with high stakes
Social pressures, historical events, or cultural conflicts
The push and pull of romantic tension and relationship obstacles

questions.question: What writing voice feels most natural to you?

answers.text: Lyrical and poetic, focusing on beautiful language and deeper meaning
Direct and accessible, prioritizing clear communication and relatability
Atmospheric and immersive, creating mood and tension through description
Rich and detailed, bringing worlds and cultures to vivid life
Emotionally charged and intimate, making readers feel deeply connected

questions.question: How dark are you willing to go with your content?

answers.text: I prefer uplifting stories that inspire and heal
I'll explore difficult topics but always with hope for redemption
I'm drawn to morally complex situations without clear answers
I want to explore the shadows of human nature and taboo subjects
Darkness is fine as long as it serves the story and character development

questions.question: What length feels right for the stories you want to tell?

answers.text: Short and punchy - I want to deliver impact quickly
Standard novel length - enough space for full character development
Epic length - I have complex worlds and multiple storylines to explore
Series potential - I want to follow characters through multiple books
Depends on what the story needs - I'm flexible with length

questions.question: What tropes or storytelling elements do you find yourself gravitating toward?

answers.text: Enemies to lovers, forbidden romance, and passionate intensity
Chosen ones, mentor figures, and coming-of-age journeys
Unreliable narrators, plot twists, and psychological manipulation
Found family, redemption arcs, and overcoming impossible odds
I prefer to subvert common tropes and create something unexpected

questions.question: What kind of ending satisfies you most as a writer?

answers.text: Happily ever after - love conquers all and hope is restored
Happy for now - positive but realistic, with room for growth
Bittersweet - victory comes with significant cost or sacrifice
Shocking twist - everything the reader thought they knew is wrong
Open-ended - readers must decide what the resolution means

questions.question: When you read, what keeps you turning pages?

answers.text: Sexual tension and the anticipation of romantic payoff
Suspense and the need to solve mysteries or uncover secrets
Beautiful prose and deep insights into the human condition
Adventure, magic, and discovering new fantastical elements
Learning something new or gaining practical insights I can apply

questions.question: What type of research excites you most?

answers.text: Historical periods, customs, and authentic cultural details
Psychology, human behavior, and criminal minds
Mythology, folklore, and creating consistent magical systems
Scientific studies, expert interviews, and evidence-based practices
I prefer to draw from personal experience and emotional truth

questions.question: What motivates you to write?

answers.text: I want to help people heal, grow, and transform their lives
I want to entertain and provide escapism from everyday reality
I want to explore the complexities and contradictions of human nature
I want to create thrilling experiences that keep readers on edge
I want to celebrate love and the power of human connection

questions.question: What kind of emotional journey do you want to take your readers on?

answers.text: From heartbreak to healing, showing that love can overcome past wounds
From safety to danger, pushing boundaries and exploring forbidden desires
From confusion to clarity, helping them understand themselves and their world better
From ordinary to extraordinary, opening their minds to infinite possibilities
From certainty to doubt, making them question everything they thought they knew

questions.question: How do you prefer to handle mature content in your writing?

answers.text: Explicit and detailed - I want readers to feel everything intensely
Tastefully implied - emotional intimacy matters more than explicit details
Mature themes are fine but sex isn't the focus of my stories
I prefer to keep things clean and focus on emotional connections
I'll include whatever serves the story, regardless of comfort levels

questions.question: What aspect of character development interests you most?

answers.text: Healing from trauma and learning to trust and love again
The gradual reveal of hidden darkness or psychological complexity
Growing into power and learning to wield abilities responsibly
Overcoming limiting beliefs and achieving personal transformation
Navigating moral dilemmas and the consequences of difficult choices

questions.question: What kind of dialogue do you enjoy writing most?

answers.text: Witty banter and sexual tension between romantic leads
Cryptic exchanges that hide deeper meanings and intentions
Rich, period-appropriate speech that brings historical eras to life
Authentic teenage voices dealing with coming-of-age challenges
Clear, helpful conversations that educate and inspire

questions.question: What type of conflict drives your best story ideas?

answers.text: Person vs. self - internal struggles and emotional growth
Person vs. person - intense relationships and interpersonal drama
Person vs. society - challenging systems and fighting for change
Person vs. supernatural - battles against magical or otherworldly forces
Person vs. unknown - mysteries, secrets, and things that go bump in the night

questions.question: How important is historical accuracy versus creative freedom in your writing?

answers.text: Historical accuracy is crucial - I want to honor the real experiences of the past
I'll bend history for a better love story, but keep the emotional truth
I prefer creating my own worlds where I can control all the rules
I like contemporary settings where I can focus on current issues and relationships
Factual accuracy matters most - truth is stranger than fiction

questions.question: What reader response do you most want to achieve?

answers.text: I want them to feel hopeful and believe in the power of love
I want them to question everything they thought they knew
I want them to escape into a world more magical than their own
I want them to gain insights that improve their real life
I want them to feel deeply and think about what it means to be human

questions.question: What draws you to read a book's first page?

answers.text: Beautiful, lyrical language that makes ordinary moments feel profound
An immediate sense of danger, mystery, or something being very wrong
A compelling character voice that feels authentic and relatable
Rich world-building that immediately transports me somewhere new
A promise of practical wisdom or life-changing insights

questions.question: How do you handle pacing in your storytelling?

answers.text: Slow and steady - I like to savor character development and relationship building
Fast and intense - I want to keep readers breathless and turning pages
Variable pacing - quiet moments balanced with action and revelation
Structured progression - clear steps toward growth and transformation
Emotional pacing - speeding up and slowing down based on character needs

questions.question: What kind of research rabbit holes do you find yourself falling into?

answers.text: Crime cases, forensics, and the psychology of criminals and victims
Ancient civilizations, mythology, and magical practices from different cultures
Relationship psychology, attachment styles, and healing from trauma
Historical events, daily life in past eras, and social movements
Personal development, neuroscience, and evidence-based wellness practices

questions.question: What type of stakes feel most compelling to you as a writer?

answers.text: Life or death - physical survival and protecting loved ones
Love or loss - finding connection or facing eternal loneliness
Truth or delusion - understanding reality versus living in false beliefs
Freedom or oppression - breaking chains versus accepting subjugation
Growth or stagnation - evolving into your best self versus staying stuck

questions.question: How do you prefer to reveal information to your readers?

answers.text: Gradual reveals through character introspection and emotional discoveries
Strategic withholding and shocking reveals that recontextualize everything
Rich exposition woven throughout adventure and world exploration
Clear, direct communication that prioritizes understanding over mystery
Layered storytelling where each re-read reveals new depths

questions.question: What legacy do you want your writing to leave?

answers.text: I want to help people believe in love and their capacity for happiness
I want to challenge readers and expand their understanding of what fiction can do
I want to create escapist worlds that readers return to for comfort and wonder
I want to provide practical tools that genuinely improve people's lives
I want to illuminate the dark corners of human experience with unflinching honesty

contemporary_romance.title: Contemporary Romance Writer
contemporary_romance.description: You're destined to write love stories that heal hearts and restore faith in happily ever after. Your creative soul is drawn to the transformative power of love in modern settings.
contemporary_romance.extended:
Your creative soul is drawn to the transformative power of love in modern settings. You understand that the best contemporary romance isn't just about finding 'the one' - it's about two flawed, real people choosing to grow together and heal each other's wounds. Your stories would likely feature relatable characters dealing with real-world challenges like career pressures, family dynamics, past trauma, or personal insecurities.

You have an instinct for emotional authenticity and the patience to develop relationships that feel genuine rather than rushed. Your writing voice would naturally lean toward accessible yet emotionally rich prose that makes readers feel deeply connected to your characters. You're drawn to the slow burn of building tension through meaningful conversations, shared experiences, and gradually deepening trust.

Your plots would likely focus on realistic obstacles that modern couples actually face - career conflicts, family disapproval, past relationships, personal insecurities, or simply the challenge of opening your heart after being hurt. You'd excel at showing how love doesn't magically solve all problems but rather gives people the strength and motivation to solve them together.

Your endings would be hopeful and healing, showing that love really can conquer the obstacles that matter most. You believe in second chances, personal growth, and the idea that the right person can help us become our best selves. Your readers would close your books feeling optimistic about their own capacity for love and happiness.

dark_romance.title: Dark Romance Writer
dark_romance.description: You're called to explore the shadows of desire, writing love stories that dance on the edge of danger. Your creative instincts are drawn to the complex, morally ambiguous territory where passion meets peril.
dark_romance.extended:
Your creative instincts are drawn to the complex, morally ambiguous territory where passion meets peril. Dark romance isn't about glorifying toxicity - it's about exploring the full spectrum of human desire, including the parts that polite society prefers to ignore. Your stories would feature intense, all-consuming relationships that challenge conventional notions of healthy love while ultimately affirming the transformative power of connection.

You're naturally drawn to antiheroes and morally gray characters who do questionable things for understandable reasons. Your heroes might be criminals with strict codes of honor, damaged soldiers haunted by their past, powerful men whose love comes with strings attached, or anyone whose capacity for violence is matched only by their capacity for devotion.

Your writing would be atmospheric and emotionally charged, creating a sense of tension and anticipation that keeps readers breathless. You understand that controversial elements must serve the emotional story, not overshadow it - every dark moment should ultimately serve the characters' journey toward healing and connection.

Your endings would be hopeful but hard-won, showing that even damaged people can find redemption through love, though the path is never easy. You believe that some of the most powerful love stories emerge from the darkest places, and that healing is possible even for people who have done terrible things or survived unspeakable trauma.

psychological_thriller.title: Psychological Thriller Writer
psychological_thriller.description: You're meant to craft mind-bending stories that explore the dark labyrinth of the human psyche. Your creative mind is fascinated by the unreliable nature of memory, perception, and truth itself.
psychological_thriller.extended:
Your creative mind is fascinated by the unreliable nature of memory, perception, and truth itself. Psychological thrillers are your calling because you understand that the most terrifying monsters are often the ones that live inside our own minds. Your stories would focus on character psychology rather than external action, creating suspense through doubt, paranoia, and the gradual revelation that nothing is quite what it seems.

You excel at creating unreliable narrators whose grip on reality becomes increasingly tenuous as the story progresses. Your plots would be intricate puzzles where every clue matters and the final revelation recontextualizes everything the reader thought they knew. You understand how to plant seeds of doubt that grow throughout the narrative, making readers question not only what's happening to your characters but also their own perceptions and assumptions.

Your writing voice would be precise and atmospheric, capable of conveying subtle shifts in mental state and building dread through seemingly ordinary details. You understand that the most effective psychological horror comes from making readers feel like they're losing their grip on reality alongside your characters.

Your endings might be shocking, ambiguous, or deeply unsettling - but always psychologically satisfying in the sense that they provide answers while potentially raising new questions about the nature of truth and reality. You believe that the best psychological thrillers don't just entertain but actually change how readers think about memory, identity, and the reliability of their own perceptions.

fantasy.title: Fantasy Writer
fantasy.description: You're destined to build magical worlds where anything is possible and epic stories unfold. Your imagination is vast and untethered by the limitations of reality.
fantasy.extended:
Your imagination is vast and untethered by the limitations of reality. Fantasy writing calls to you because you have the rare ability to create entire worlds from scratch - complete with their own histories, cultures, magic systems, and mythologies. You're not just telling a story; you're creating a universe where readers can lose themselves completely.

Your mind naturally thinks in terms of world-building, considering how magic would affect society, what kinds of creatures might exist in different environments, and how political systems would develop in worlds where some people have supernatural powers. You're drawn to epic quests, chosen ones, magical creatures, and the eternal battle between good and evil, but you also understand that the best fantasy is grounded in real human emotions and struggles.

Your writing would be rich and immersive, painting vivid pictures of landscapes that exist nowhere but in your imagination. You have the patience for detailed world-building and the creativity to develop cultures, languages, and mythologies that feel authentic and lived-in. Your stories would likely span multiple books, allowing you to explore the full depth and complexity of your created worlds.

Your plots would likely involve high stakes - the fate of kingdoms, the balance between magical forces, or epic conflicts that determine the future of entire worlds. You believe in the power of hope, friendship, and courage to overcome even the darkest evil, though you understand that victory should never come easily or without significant cost.

literary_fiction.title: Literary Fiction Writer
literary_fiction.description: You're called to illuminate the human condition through beautiful language and profound insight. Your creative soul is drawn to the complexities of human existence and the power of language to reveal universal truths.
literary_fiction.extended:
Your creative soul is drawn to the complexities of human existence and the power of language to reveal universal truths. Literary fiction calls to you because you understand that the best stories aren't just about what happens, but about what it means - both to your characters and to the broader human experience. You're fascinated by the subtle ways people change and grow, the moral ambiguities that define real life, and the small moments that reveal profound truths about who we are as human beings.

You excel at creating layered, complex characters whose internal landscapes are as important as their external circumstances. Your protagonists would be flawed, realistic people grappling with questions that don't have easy answers - questions about identity, purpose, mortality, love, loss, and what it means to live a meaningful life.

Your writing voice would be distinctive and carefully crafted, with attention to the rhythm and music of language as well as its meaning. You believe that how something is said is just as important as what is said, and you'd excel at finding fresh ways to express timeless human experiences. Your prose would likely be rich with symbolism, metaphor, and subtext, rewarding readers who pay attention to nuance and deeper meaning.

Your stories would explore the full complexity of human nature, examining both our capacity for cruelty and our potential for grace. You understand that the most compelling conflicts are often internal, playing out in the space between what people want and what they need, what they believe and what they discover, what they hope for and what they fear.

young_adult.title: Young Adult Writer
young_adult.description: You're meant to capture the intensity and possibility of young adulthood in stories that inspire and empower. Your creative instincts are perfectly attuned to the unique challenges and possibilities of adolescence.
young_adult.extended:
Your creative instincts are perfectly attuned to the unique challenges and possibilities of adolescence and young adulthood. You understand that this period of life is characterized by intense emotions, rapid change, and the exciting but terrifying process of discovering who you are and what you want from life. Your stories would speak directly to readers who are navigating the transition between childhood and adulthood, offering both escape and guidance during one of life's most transformative periods.

You excel at creating authentic teenage voices that capture the way young people actually think and speak without condescending or oversimplifying their experiences. Your protagonists would be coming-of-age, dealing with issues like identity formation, first love, friendship drama, family expectations, academic pressure, and the overwhelming question of what to do with their lives.

Your writing would balance relatability with escapism, grounding fantastical or dramatic elements in the very real emotional experiences of growing up. Whether you're writing contemporary realistic fiction, fantasy, science fiction, or romance, your stories would always center on themes of self-discovery, finding your place in the world, and learning to trust your own voice and instincts.

Your characters would face real stakes that matter deeply to young people - the fear of not belonging, the pressure to make life-defining decisions, the intensity of first love, the pain of betrayal by friends, and the challenge of standing up for what you believe in. Your stories would validate the very real struggles of young people while inspiring them to believe in their own power to shape their futures.

historical_fiction.title: Historical Fiction Writer
historical_fiction.description: You're drawn to bringing the past to life through meticulously researched and emotionally resonant stories. Your imagination is captivated by the rich tapestry of human history.
historical_fiction.extended:
Your imagination is captivated by the rich tapestry of human history and your desire to transport readers to different eras. Historical fiction calls to you because you understand that the past isn't really past - that the struggles, triumphs, and emotions of people who lived centuries ago are fundamentally similar to our own. You're fascinated by how people lived, loved, and survived in times very different from our own, and you have the patience and dedication required to research and authentically recreate historical periods.

You excel at balancing historical accuracy with compelling storytelling, understanding that readers want both education and entertainment. Your characters would be products of their time while still feeling relatable and human to modern audiences. You're drawn to exploring how major historical events affected ordinary people, showing the human cost and triumph of wars, social movements, cultural shifts, and technological changes.

Your writing would be rich with period detail but never at the expense of emotional authenticity. You'd excel at showing how historical constraints could create unique challenges and opportunities for your characters, making their struggles feel both foreign and familiar to modern readers.

Your stories would likely explore themes of social change, cultural conflict, and the ways that individual choices intersect with larger historical forces. You understand that the best historical fiction doesn't just recreate the past but helps readers understand how history continues to shape our present and future.

suspense.title: Suspense Writer
suspense.description: You're meant to master the art of keeping readers on the edge of their seats, breathless with anticipation. Your creative instincts are perfectly tuned to the delicate art of building and maintaining tension.
suspense.extended:
Your creative instincts are perfectly tuned to the delicate art of building and maintaining tension. Suspense writing calls to you because you understand that the most thrilling stories aren't necessarily about what happens, but about the anticipation of what might happen. You excel at creating that page-turning quality that makes readers stay up all night because they simply can't put your book down.

You have an intuitive understanding of pacing and timing, knowing exactly when to reveal crucial information and when to hold it back. Your stories would likely feature ordinary people thrust into extraordinary circumstances, creating immediate reader identification and investment. You understand that the best suspense comes from making readers care deeply about your characters and then putting those characters in increasingly dangerous or uncertain situations.

Your writing would be lean and efficient, designed to keep readers moving through the story without getting bogged down in unnecessary description. You'd excel at creating believable threats and equally believable heroes capable of facing those threats, often involving real-world concerns like terrorism, corporate corruption, or international conflict.

Your plots would likely involve races against time, hidden conspiracies, or gradually revealed threats that become increasingly urgent as the story progresses. You understand that effective suspense requires not just external danger but also internal stakes that make readers emotionally invested in the outcome.

self_help.title: Self-Help Writer
self_help.description: You're called to share wisdom and practical strategies that genuinely improve people's lives. Your creative drive is fueled by a genuine desire to help others overcome challenges and achieve their potential.
self_help.extended:
Your creative drive is fueled by a genuine desire to help others overcome challenges and achieve their potential. Self-help writing calls to you because you understand that knowledge without application is useless, and you have both the insight and communication skills necessary to translate complex concepts into actionable advice. You're drawn to exploring how people can break through limiting beliefs, develop healthier relationships, build confidence, or create more fulfilling lives.

You excel at breaking down overwhelming problems into manageable steps and presenting information in ways that feel accessible rather than preachy. Your writing would likely combine research-based strategies with relatable examples and exercises that readers can actually implement. You understand that real change requires more than just understanding - it requires sustained action and often a fundamental shift in mindset.

Your approach would likely be evidence-based but also deeply human, acknowledging that change is difficult and often non-linear. You'd excel at understanding what prevents people from making positive changes and addressing those obstacles directly. Your writing voice would be encouraging but realistic, offering hope without making promises that can't be kept.

Your ultimate goal would be to create books that actually change lives, providing readers with tools and insights they can use long after they finish reading. You believe that with the right guidance and support, people can overcome significant obstacles and create meaningful positive change in their lives.

memoir.title: Memoir Writer
memoir.description: You're meant to transform your life experiences into universal stories that inspire and connect. Your creative instincts are drawn to the power of personal narrative to illuminate universal truths.
memoir.extended:
Your creative instincts are drawn to the power of personal narrative to illuminate universal truths. Memoir writing calls to you because you understand that your own experiences, when thoughtfully examined and skillfully told, can offer insights and comfort to others facing similar challenges. You have both significant life experiences worth sharing and the self-awareness necessary to examine those experiences with honesty and nuance.

You excel at finding meaning in personal struggles and triumphs, understanding that the value of memoir lies not just in what happened to you, but in what you learned from those experiences and how you've grown as a result. Your writing would be deeply personal yet universally relatable, showing how individual experiences connect to broader human themes like resilience, love, loss, identity, and transformation.

Your voice would be authentic and vulnerable, willing to examine your own flaws and mistakes as well as your victories. You'd excel at recreating scenes with vivid detail while also providing the mature perspective that comes from having lived through and reflected on difficult experiences.

Your stories would likely focus on pivotal moments, relationships, or periods of significant change that shaped who you became. Your writing would offer hope without minimizing pain, showing readers that it's possible to not only survive difficult experiences but to find meaning and even growth through them.

historical_romance.title: Historical Romance Writer
historical_romance.description: You're destined to weave passionate love stories against the rich tapestry of bygone eras. Your creative soul is captivated by both the sweep of history and the timeless power of romantic love.
historical_romance.extended:
Your creative soul is captivated by both the sweep of history and the timeless power of romantic love. Historical romance calls to you because you understand that love stories become even more compelling when set against the backdrop of different eras, with their unique social constraints, cultural expectations, and historical events. You're drawn to exploring how people found love and fought for happiness within the specific limitations and opportunities of their time periods.

You excel at creating authentic historical settings that feel lived-in and real while never losing sight of the central love story. Your heroes and heroines would be products of their time but also relatable to modern readers, navigating both the universal challenges of falling in love and the specific obstacles created by historical circumstances.

Your writing would be rich with period detail but never at the expense of emotional authenticity. You'd excel at showing how historical constraints could intensify romantic feelings, making stolen moments more precious and hard-won victories more satisfying. Your love stories would feel both historically grounded and emotionally timeless, reminding readers that passion and connection transcend time and culture.

Your plots would likely involve conflicts between personal desire and social expectation, forbidden romances across class lines, arranged marriages that become love matches, or second chances after loss. You understand how to use historical elements to create compelling romantic conflict while ensuring that love ultimately triumphs over the obstacles of the past.

science_fiction.title: Science Fiction Writer
science_fiction.description: You're called to explore the infinite possibilities of the future and the impact of technology on humanity. Your imagination is drawn to the endless possibilities of scientific advancement and its impact on human society.
science_fiction.extended:
Your imagination is drawn to the endless possibilities of scientific advancement and its impact on human society. Science fiction calls to you because you understand that the best sci-fi isn't really about technology - it's about how technology changes us, challenges us, and forces us to confront fundamental questions about what it means to be human. You're fascinated by extrapolating current trends into possible futures and exploring the ethical, social, and personal implications of scientific progress.

You excel at creating believable future worlds based on logical extensions of current scientific knowledge while never losing sight of the human element. Your stories would likely explore themes like artificial intelligence, space exploration, genetic engineering, virtual reality, environmental change, or social evolution.

Your writing would balance scientific plausibility with narrative excitement, creating worlds that feel both fantastic and believable. You'd excel at exploring the unintended consequences of scientific advancement and the ways that technology can both solve old problems and create new ones.

Your stories would likely examine how scientific progress affects individual lives and relationships, showing that even in the most advanced future societies, people still struggle with love, identity, mortality, and purpose. You understand that the most compelling science fiction uses technological concepts as catalysts for examining timeless human concerns about survival, connection, and meaning.
